item.title: fixing legacy trusted.gpg keyring issue
item.description: Overview This warning means that a key is stored in /etc/apt/trusted.gpg which is a deprecated keyring: W: https://example.com/repo: Key is stored in legacy trusted.gpg keyring (/etc/apt/trusted.gpg), see the DEPRECATION section in apt-key(8) for details. Fixing Find the offending key: sudo apt-key list | grep -i <keyword> --before --after 3 Any keys marked expired can be ignored. An offending key will be listed under the /etc/apt/trusted.gpg section like this: pub rsa4096 2015-03-22 [SC] CD66 5CBA 0E2F 88B7 373F 7CB9 9720 3C7B 3ADC A79D uid [ unknown] Plex Inc.

item.title: add a ca certificate
item.description: Add a CA Certificate to a Debian Linux Server cp <path/to/ca-cert-file.crt> /usr/local/share/ca/certificates/ sudo update-ca-certificates
